dataAccessLayer

Class CandidateReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • dataAccessLayer.CandidateReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Reader<Candidate>

    public class CandidateReader
extends java.lang.Object
implements Reader<Candidate>
    This class implements the Reader interface for a Candidate. Meaning that the T in the Reader is replaced here by Candidate.
    Author:
    Ben-Malik TCHAMALAM

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CandidateReader() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void create(Candidate item)
      given a T type item, this one is saved to the database.
      void delete(java.lang.String item)
      Delete the object from the database whose name corresponds with the given one.
      java.util.List<Candidate> fetchAll()
      Reads the database for the T type objects and fetches them all.
      Candidate get(java.lang.String name)
      Given a particular name, this method reads the T object from the database and if any of the read objects' name corresponds with the given name, the object is returned.
      void update(Candidate item)
      Takes a particular item and updates its values with the older one in the database.

        Description copied from interface: Reader
        Given a particular name, this method reads the T object from the database and if any of the read objects' name corresponds with the given name, the object is returned.

        Returns:

      • fetchAll

        public java.util.List<Candidate> fetchAll()
        Description copied from interface: Reader
        Reads the database for the T type objects and fetches them all.
        Specified by:
        fetchAll in interface Reader<Candidate>
        Returns:
        All the T objects available in the database.

      • update

        public void update(Candidate item)
        Description copied from interface: Reader
        Takes a particular item and updates its values with the older one in the database. In case no object's name in the database matches with the given item's name, the item is saved to the database.
        Specified by:
        update in interface Reader<Candidate>
        Parameters:
        item - The T type object to be udpated.

      • delete

        public void delete(java.lang.String item)
        Description copied from interface: Reader
        Delete the object from the database whose name corresponds with the given one. Beaware that nothing is done if no object matches the given name.
        Specified by:
        delete in interface Reader<Candidate>
        Parameters:
        item - The name whose object is to be deleted.

      • create

        public void create(Candidate item)
        Description copied from interface: Reader
        given a T type item, this one is saved to the database.
        Specified by:
        create in interface Reader<Candidate>
        Parameters:
        item - The item to be saved to the database.
